Bag O' Links - 30/7/2009

31 Jul 2009

  • Good API design – not web-ish example, but definitely some things to consider if you are going to develop an API soon.
  • Web server security – article by IBM, a nice basic reviews of the threats against a web server.
  • Worst REST practices – things to watch out for when you are RESTing.
  • Use Monit to moniter, don’t trust GOD – This dude sure as hell has something against GOD.
  • OAuth explained – another tip for those of use who need to develop an API soon.
  • Nice looking JQuery scrolling plugin – this one is for me, i’ll need it soon enough.
  • 2 minutes layout generators – nice, i was wondering how to use it.

GitHub Treasures

  • germinate – i expected more from this name, but this is just yet another seeding plugin for rails.
  • simpler_record – An ActiveRecord interface for SimpleDB.
  • skinny_blog_engine – another skinny blog engine in rails, i am still hoping for a decent replacement to Mephisto before i turn back to WordPress.
  • xss_terminate – a plugin in that makes stripping and sanitizing HTML stupid-simple. Install and forget.
  • formtastic – a semantic, clean form builder for Rails.
